intro: Thalictrum obtusilobum, commonly known as the blunt-lobed meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually yellow or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodlands, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are palmately compound, with broad, rounded lobes that give it a distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in early summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
